channel.title: tor on Hi, I'm Kyle
channel.description: Recent content in tor on Hi, I'm Kyle

item.title: Avoid Detection with Nmap Stealth Scan and Tor
item.description: The nmap stealth scan -sS flag allows you to search for open ports by adjusting the TCP/IP three way handshake: The handshake ordinarily is SYN -> SYN ACK -> ACK The -sS flags change the handshake to SYN -> SYN ACK -> RST Defined: Synchronize, Acknowledge, Reset This makes it less likely, but certainty not impossible for an intrusion detection system to pickup the scan. The best approach that I can think of would be to use the -sS flag and between each port tested use Tor to change IPs from within a regionally anticipated region based on the purpose and location of the target.
